documentType: arrest processing form and criminal history record
summary: This document is a US Marshals Service arrest processing form (USM-312) and attached criminal history record for Michael Thomas, a Federal Bureau of Prisons corrections officer arrested on 11/19/2019 for making false statements and conspiracy to make false statements. It includes his personal details, employment information, and a criminal history check revealing a prior arrest in New Jersey.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: The primary subject of the arrest document, taken into federal custody on charges of making false statements and conspiracy to make false statements. He is identified as a Federal Bureau of Prisons corrections officer.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Listed in the 'Associates / Co-Defendants / Relatives / Children' section of the arrest form with the relationship 'Significant Other' to Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner, NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: His name and title appear on the letterhead of the criminal history record response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.

connections.description: Listed as 'Significant Other' in the arrest form's associates section.

events.title: Arrest of Michael Thomas
events.description: Michael Thomas is taken into federal custody by the FBI at 290 Broadway, New York, on charges of making false statements (18 USC 1001) and conspiracy to make false statements (18 USC 371).

events.title: Prior Arrest of Michael Thomas in New Jersey
events.description: Michael Thomas was arrested in Plainfield, New Jersey, on charges including aggravated assault, criminal restraint, criminal mischief, harassment, and unlawful possession of a firearm. The case was resolved via Pre-Trial Intervention (PTI) and dismissed.

locations: 290 Broadway, New York, NY (Location of Arrest)
150 Park Row, New York, NY (Employment Address - Federal BOP)
Plainfield, New Jersey (Location of prior arrest)
MDC Brooklyn (Mentioned as detention facility on property receipt)
keyFacts: Michael Thomas, a Federal Bureau of Prisons corrections officer, was arrested on federal charges of making false statements and conspiracy to make false statements on November 19, 2019.
The arrest document lists Tova Noel as his 'Significant Other' in the associates section.

A criminal history check reveals a prior 2010 arrest in Plainfield, New Jersey, for serious charges including aggravated assault and unlawful firearm possession, which was dismissed after Pre-Trial Intervention.
The defendant had no property upon intake into custody, as indicated on the Federal Prisoner's Property Receipt.
The document shows coordination between the FBI, US Marshals Service, and state criminal history repositories (New Jersey, New York) for background checks.
